payload.instructions:
## Skills
These skills are discovered at startup from multiple local sources. Each entry includes a name, description, and file path so you can open the source for full instructions.
- skill-creator: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Codex's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations. (file: C:/Users/krkna/.codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/SKILL.md)
- skill-installer: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos). (file: C:/Users/krkna/.codex/skills/.system/skill-installer/SKILL.md)
- Discovery: Available skills are listed in project docs and may also appear in a runtime "## Skills" section (name + description + file path). These are the sources of truth; skill bodies live on disk at the listed paths.
- Trigger rules: If the user names a skill (with `$SkillName` or plain text) OR the task clearly matches a skill's description, you must use that skill for that turn. Multiple mentions mean use them all. Do not carry skills across turns unless re-mentioned.
- Missing/blocked: If a named skill isn't in the list or the path can't be read, say so briefly and continue with the best fallback.
- How to use a skill (progressive disclosure):
  1) After deciding to use a skill, open its `SKILL.md`. Read only enough to follow the workflow.
  2) If `SKILL.md` points to extra folders such as `references/`, load only the specific files needed for the request; don't bulk-load everything.
  3) If `scripts/` exist, prefer running or patching them instead of retyping large code blocks.
  4) If `assets/` or templates exist, reuse them instead of recreating from scratch.
- Description as trigger: The YAML `description` in `SKILL.md` is the primary trigger signal; rely on it to decide applicability. If unsure, ask a brief clarification before proceeding.
- Coordination and sequencing:
  - If multiple skills apply, choose the minimal set that covers the request and state the order you'll use them.
  - Announce which skill(s) you're using and why (one short line). If you skip an obvious skill, say why.
- Context hygiene:
  - Keep context small: summarize long sections instead of pasting them; only load extra files when needed.
  - Avoid deeply nested references; prefer one-hop files explicitly linked from `SKILL.md`.
  - When variants exist (frameworks, providers, domains), pick only the relevant reference file(s) and note that choice.
- Safety and fallback: If a skill can't be applied cleanly (missing files, unclear instructions), state the issue, pick the next-best approach, and continue.

content.text:
# AGENTS.md instructions for d:\Game builds\Pixel Pal

<INSTRUCTIONS>
## Skills
These skills are discovered at startup from multiple local sources. Each entry includes a name, description, and file path so you can open the source for full instructions.
- skill-creator: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Codex's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations. (file: C:/Users/krkna/.codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/SKILL.md)
- skill-installer: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos). (file: C:/Users/krkna/.codex/skills/.system/skill-installer/SKILL.md)
- Discovery: Available skills are listed in project docs and may also appear in a runtime "## Skills" section (name + description + file path). These are the sources of truth; skill bodies live on disk at the listed paths.
- Trigger rules: If the user names a skill (with `$SkillName` or plain text) OR the task clearly matches a skill's description, you must use that skill for that turn. Multiple mentions mean use them all. Do not carry skills across turns unless re-mentioned.
- Missing/blocked: If a named skill isn't in the list or the path can't be read, say so briefly and continue with the best fallback.
- How to use a skill (progressive disclosure):
  1) After deciding to use a skill, open its `SKILL.md`. Read only enough to follow the workflow.
  2) If `SKILL.md` points to extra folders such as `references/`, load only the specific files needed for the request; don't bulk-load everything.
  3) If `scripts/` exist, prefer running or patching them instead of retyping large code blocks.
  4) If `assets/` or templates exist, reuse them instead of recreating from scratch.
- Description as trigger: The YAML `description` in `SKILL.md` is the primary trigger signal; rely on it to decide applicability. If unsure, ask a brief clarification before proceeding.
- Coordination and sequencing:
  - If multiple skills apply, choose the minimal set that covers the request and state the order you'll use them.
  - Announce which skill(s) you're using and why (one short line). If you skip an obvious skill, say why.
- Context hygiene:
  - Keep context small: summarize long sections instead of pasting them; only load extra files when needed.
  - Avoid deeply nested references; prefer one-hop files explicitly linked from `SKILL.md`.
  - When variants exist (frameworks, providers, domains), pick only the relevant reference file(s) and note that choice.
- Safety and fallback: If a skill can't be applied cleanly (missing files, unclear instructions), state the issue, pick the next-best approach, and continue.
</INSTRUCTIONS>

# Context from my IDE setup:

## Active file: .agent/staging/PROMPT_AGENT_1_UX_ARCHITECT.txt

## Active selection of the file:
# AGENT 1: UX ARCHITECT (Codex 5.2)

## Role
You are a **UX Architect** specializing in tablet-first game interfaces.

## Context
Read: `.agent/staging/SYSTEM_STATE.md`

## Your Focus Areas
1. **Navigation Architecture** - Design the new hierarchy
2. **Information Architecture** - How content flows between screens
3. **User Journey Mapping** - Paths through Villages > Houses > Rooms

## Tasks
1. Analyze current `pages/` structure and propose new routing
2. Design wireframe layouts for:
   - MainMap (hub)
   - VillagesList with master-detail
   - HouseDetail with room navigation
   - Playroom concept (replacing PhysicsPlayground visibility)
3. Define touch interaction patterns for tablet
4. Recommend navigation components (TabBar, SideNav, Breadcrumbs)

## Output Format
```markdown
# UX ARCHITECT REPORT

## Navigation Structure
[Proposed routing with React Router paths]

## Wireframes
[ASCII or description of key screens]

## Touch Patterns
[Gesture recommendations]

## Component Recommendations
[List with rationale]

## Risks
[Migration concerns, breaking changes]
```

## Ironclad Protocol
- Output to: `.agent/staging/responses/AGENT_1_UX_ARCHITECT.md`
- Include header: `# AGENT_1_UX_ARCHITECT | Codex 5.2 | [timestamp]`
- Status must be: COMPLETE, PARTIAL, or BLOCKED

## Open tabs:
- PROMPT_AGENT_1_UX_ARCHITECT.txt: .agent/staging/PROMPT_AGENT_1_UX_ARCHITECT.txt
- AGENT_4_QA_SPECIALIST.md: .agent/staging/responses/AGENT_4_QA_SPECIALIST.md
- inputManager.spec.ts: src/frontend/tests/integration/inputManager.spec.ts
- PROMPT_AGENT_4_QA_SPECIALIST.txt: .agent/staging/PROMPT_AGENT_4_QA_SPECIALIST.txt
- PROMPT_AGENT_3_PERFORMANCE_ENGINEER.txt: .agent/staging/PROMPT_AGENT_3_PERFORMANCE_ENGINEER.txt

# SYSTEM_STATE - UI/UX Redesign Tribunal

## Project: Pixel Pal

**Date**: 2025-12-28  
**Objective**: Comprehensive UI/UX redesign for tablet-first gameplay

---

## Current State Summary

### Tech Stack

- **Frontend**: React 18, TypeScript, Vite, RTK Query, Framer Motion
- **Backend**: NestJS, Prisma, PostgreSQL
- **Current Icons**: Lucide React (to be removed)
- **Current Layout**: Desktop-first, needs tablet optimization

### Key Files

```
src/frontend/
ÃÄÄ pages/
³   ÃÄÄ Index.tsx (830 lines) - Main page, to become MainMap
³   ÃÄÄ Village.tsx (743 lines) - Village view
³   ÃÄÄ Adventures.tsx - Adventure system
³   ÀÄÄ HomeInterior.tsx - House interior
ÃÄÄ components/
³   ÃÄÄ PhysicsPlayground.tsx (636 lines) - Hidden physics, rename to Playroom
³   ÃÄÄ VillageGrid.tsx - Village grid layout
³   ÃÄÄ PalCard.tsx - Pal display cards
³   ÀÄÄ ui/ (49 shadcn components)
ÀÄÄ api/
    ÃÄÄ homesApi.ts - RTK Query for homes
    ÃÄÄ playerApi.ts - RTK Query for player
    ÀÄÄ inventoryApi.ts - RTK Query for inventory
```

---

## Requirements

### 1. Navigation Hierarchy

```
Main Map  Villages/Events/Adventures
ÃÄÄ Villages  Houses  Rooms  Pals
ÃÄÄ Events  Pal Selection  Equipment
ÃÄÄ Adventures  Pal Selection  Equipment
ÃÄÄ Shop (independent) - Pal Store, Adoption
ÃÄÄ Inventory (independent) - Pals, Items
ÀÄÄ Codex - Universal help/info
```

### 2. Tablet Optimization

- Target: iPad Pro 12.9" (1024x1366) primary
- Touch targets ò44px
- No horizontal scroll
- Master-detail layouts

### 3. Design Overhaul

- Remove Lucide React icons
- Professional color palette (not cheap AI-gen aesthetic)
- Premium typography (Plus Jakarta Sans, Inter)
- Refined micro-animations

### 4. PhysicsPlayground

- Hide canvas-based physics from user
- Rename "Start Physics"  "Playroom" concept
- Integrate as room type or dedicated zone

### 5. Asset Manifest

- Create manifest for image generation
- Include: prompt template, sizing, format, naming
- Categories: pals, environments, icons, ui

---

## Deliverables Expected

Each agent should produce:

1. **Analysis** of their domain within the redesign
2. **Specific recommendations** with file paths
3. **Code snippets** where applicable
4. **Risk assessment** for their area

payload.name: apply_patch
payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Add File: .agent/staging/responses/AGENT_1_UX_ARCHITECT.md
+# AGENT_1_UX_ARCHITECT | Codex 5.2 | 2025-12-28 20:13
+Status: COMPLETE
+
+# UX ARCHITECT REPORT
+
+## Navigation Structure
+Proposed React Router paths mapped to current pages and new hierarchy:
+- `/` -> MainMap (current `src/frontend/pages/Index.tsx`)
+- `/villages` -> VillagesList (new screen; master-detail shell)
+- `/villages/:villageId` -> VillageDetail (current `src/frontend/pages/Village.tsx` refactored)
+- `/villages/:villageId/houses/:houseId` -> HouseDetail (current `src/frontend/pages/HomeInterior.tsx` refactored)
+- `/villages/:villageId/houses/:houseId/rooms/:roomId` -> RoomDetail (new view inside HouseDetail)
+- `/playroom` -> Playroom (rename of `src/frontend/components/PhysicsPlayground.tsx` exposed as page)
+- `/adventures` -> Adventures (current `src/frontend/pages/Adventures.tsx`)
+- `/events` -> Events (new; routes to Pal selection and equipment)
+- `/shop` -> Shop (new; independent)
+- `/inventory` -> Inventory (new; independent)
+- `/codex` -> Codex (new; help/info)
+- `*` -> NotFound (current `src/frontend/pages/NotFound.tsx`)
+
+Notes:
+- Keep `src/frontend/App.tsx` as router host; update routes to reflect new hierarchy.
+- Village, House, and Room paths mirror the requirements and support deep-linking from MainMap.
+
+## Wireframes
+MainMap (hub)
+```
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+| TopBar: Player | Currency | Settings | Codex            |
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+| [Map Canvas]    [Events]  [Adventures]  [Shop]          |
+|  - village pins w/ status                              |
+|  - swipe map, pinch zoom                               |
+|                                                       |
+|  Bottom Dock: [Villages] [Inventory] [Playroom]        |
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+```
+
+VillagesList (master-detail)
+```
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+| TopBar: Back | Villages | Filters                      |
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+| List (left 35%)        | Detail (right 65%)            |
+| - Village A            | [Village Snapshot]            |
+| - Village B            | - Houses grid                 |
+| - Village C            | - Residents count             |
+|                         | - CTA: Enter Village          |
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+```
+
+HouseDetail with room navigation
+```
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+| TopBar: Back to Village | House Name | Status          |
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+| Room Rail (left) | Main Room Canvas (center)           |
+| - Kitchen        | - room scene w/ pals                |
+| - Bedroom        | - quick actions                     |
+| - Playroom       | - room info panel (right)           |
+| - Garden         |                                     |
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+```
+
+Playroom concept (replacing PhysicsPlayground visibility)
+```
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+| TopBar: Back | Playroom | Tips                         |
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+| Full-screen scene w/ physics interactions              |
+| - clear "Start Play" button                            |
+| - tool strip: toys, obstacles, reset                   |
+| - safety overlay for tutorial                          |
+-----------------------------------------------------------
+```
+
+## Touch Patterns
+- Map: one-finger pan, two-finger pinch zoom, double-tap to focus village.
+- Lists: vertical scroll with sticky section headers; tap selects, swipe left for quick actions.
+- Rooms: horizontal swipe to move between rooms; vertical swipe on room canvas to reveal room actions.
+- Drag-and-drop: toys or pals within Playroom, snap-to-zones for accessibility.
+- Long-press: contextual actions (rename room, move pal) with 44px+ targets.
+
+## Component Recommendations
+- TabBar (bottom) for global sections: MainMap, Villages, Inventory, Playroom.
+- SideNav (left rail) within HouseDetail for rooms; supports quick switching.
+- Breadcrumbs in TopBar for Villages > Houses > Rooms; preserves hierarchy.
+- MasterDetailShell for tablet layouts; reduce mode switches between list and detail.
+- Floating Action Button (contextual) for "Enter Village" or "Start Play".
+
+## Risks
+- Route migration: deep links from `src/frontend/App.tsx` will break without redirects.
+- Page refactors: `src/frontend/pages/Village.tsx` and `src/frontend/pages/HomeInterior.tsx` are large; splitting into shells + detail panes needs careful state migration.
+- Playroom exposure: `src/frontend/components/PhysicsPlayground.tsx` was hidden; user-facing onboarding and safety gates required.
+- Input patterns: existing gestures in `src/frontend/systems/GestureHandler` may conflict with new swipe navigation.
*** End Patch

payload.message:
Created the UX architect report with proposed routing, wireframes, touch patterns, component recommendations, and risks in `.agent/staging/responses/AGENT_1_UX_ARCHITECT.md`.

Next steps you may want:
1) Have me map the new routes into `src/frontend/App.tsx` with redirects for legacy paths.  
2) Expand one wireframe into a detailed screen spec with component hierarchy and states.

content.text:
Created the UX architect report with proposed routing, wireframes, touch patterns, component recommendations, and risks in `.agent/staging/responses/AGENT_1_UX_ARCHITECT.md`.

Next steps you may want:
1) Have me map the new routes into `src/frontend/App.tsx` with redirects for legacy paths.  
2) Expand one wireframe into a detailed screen spec with component hierarchy and states.
